item.title: Hazelight Is Already Working On Its Next Game
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/hazelight-is-already-working-on-its-next-game/

Split Fiction has only been out for a little under two weeks—as of writing—and the game has seen incredible success in a short period of time. But that doesn’t mean developer Hazelight is resting on its laurels. In fact, Hazelight is already working on its next game.

In an interview with the Friends Per Second podcast, Hazelight head Josef Fares confirmed that the studio began working on its next title about a month ago.

“Split Fiction is the best-received game we have done, everybody is super happy, but I’m so fully focused and excited on the next thing, that we’ve already started,” Fares said.

Fares added that the next game is still “way too early” in its development, but they have about 130 pages so far of current ideas for the game’s story.

“[It’s] mostly in the story, what’s going to happen but a little bit in gameplay as well,” he said. “It’s kind of like, ‘this is where we start, this is where we’re going.”

With Split Fiction having done so well at release, Fares says that the studio has a belief that it can do anything it puts effort towards. He said that the overall mood of the company is as good as its ever been, and there is a confidence of topping its past releases.

“We just feel like, when we talk in the lunchroom or we talk to each other, we’re like, ‘Oh shit, we feel we can do better than this.’,” he said. “That’s how confident we feel, and people are very happy and excited. It’s a very happy place, Hazelight.”

item.title: LEGO x Pokémon Partnership Officially Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/lego-x-pokemon-partnership-officially-confirmed/

The LEGO website has been updated to confirm their upcoming partnership with Pokémon. 

Hours ago, a teaser video about the partnership between LEGO and Pokémon surfaced online before being abruptly removed. Now, the LEGO website’s themes section has been officially updated to feature the brand-new partnership with Pokémon. Not many details have been revealed about the collaboration other than the fact that it will arrive in 2026. 

Per the press release, the LEGO Group and The Pokémon Company have signed a multi-year partnership to bring the world of Pokémon to life through LEGO bricks. Until now, Pokémon had a licensing agreement with Mattel, which allowed the latter to sell buildable characters, play sets, building blocks, and sets for the franchise through its Mega Bloks brand. However, the new partnership should end Pokémon’s deal with Mattel. 

Julia Goldin, Chief Product & Marketing Officer of the LEGO Group, has stated that “this partnership will create a range of new possibilities for Trainers and builders alike.” Gaku Susai, Chief Product and Experience Officer at The Pokémon Company International, added, “The LEGO Group and Pokémon have strong shared values of imagination, creativity and fun, making this the perfect partnership to deliver unique, meaningful and engaging ways for Trainers to experience the Pokémon brand.”

In other news, Pokémon TCG Pocket is getting a new rival in Digimon. Also, Scopely acquired the Pokémon GO developer for $3.5 billion. What are your thoughts on LEGO x Pokémon? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

item.title: The First Berserker Khazan Preload Guide & How Big it is—File Sizes Explained
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/the-first-berserker-khazan-preload-guide-file-sizes/

Our preload and file size guide for The First Berserker Khazan can get you armed and ready. Before you step into the shoes of the soon-to-be-influenced general Khazan, you first need to preload the game if you’ve pre-ordered it, and you definitely need to know how much space you need.

There’s a lot of expectation on the shoulders of The First Berserker Khazan. It’s one of 2025’s biggest action-adventure and Soulslike titles, and it has a lot of fans already. We know the basics of the story, we’ve seen the Trophy List, and we also know if it’s on Game Pass.

But for details on the preload process and how much space Khazan requires, we’ve got everything you need to know.

How to Preload The First Berserker Khazan

You can preload The First Berserker Khazan approximately 24 hours before release if you have a confirmed pre-order digital purchase of the game.

Preloading is another recent popular gaming trend. It allows you to have an upcoming game already installed on your device allowing you to play it as soon as its worldwide launch rolls out.

Here’s a basic step-by-step guide if you’ve never done this before:

  1. Decide if you’re playing The First Berserker Khazan on PlayStation, Xbox, or PC.
  2. Head to your chosen digital storefront.
  3. Find the search function and look for The First Berserker Khazan.
  4. Choose any Khazan edition.
  5. Confirm and complete your purchase.
  6. Wait for the preload option to go live—we think it’s in the 24 hours leading up to Early Access.
  7. Click the download option once it’s available.
  8. Once it’s installed, The First Berserker Khazan should be in your games library raring and ready to go.

Using the Steam page as evidence, it says: “Pre-Purchase this edition and play the game starting three days ahead of full release. Starts in approximately six days.” This means you can expect the preload option to go live in the 24 hours building up to the start of Early Access.

The First Berserker Khazan File Size on PlayStation, Xbox & PC

The PlayStation File Size for The First Berserker Khazan is 25.820 GB, and you need at least 70 GB on Xbox and PC.

There’s a notable discrepancy between PlayStation, Xbox, and PC, but I wouldn’t worry if you’re playing Khazan on the latter formats. PlayStation Game Size—a reputable source of file sizes—confirmed the PS5 file size, whereas the PC and Xbox sizes come from the official Khazan Xbox and Steam pages.

Xbox and PC say you need a least 70 GB—but this doesn’t mean you need 70 GB or anything close come release. To be on the safe side, make sure you have 70 GB free, and if it does end up being far less, that’s a bonus!

Which platform are you looking to play The First Berserker Khazan on? If you are looking to pick up Khazan, you might be interested to hear it has Early Access to get you killing and thrilling ahead of its official launch date.
